result.execSummary:
The defendant Shalonda M Silas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 06/19/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-40

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- No firearms/weapons.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Complete a parenting class.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No contact with victims, UNLESS the victims requests contact, and then only after the Agent has approved a modification to No Violent Contact and it has been approved by the MBCW.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- Obtain GED/HSED.
- Obtain and maintain employment.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED pending a review on 06-19-15

***06-19-2015/ Rebecca Dallet***
Defendant is non-compliant with conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant to spend 30 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time in the HOC.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shalonda M Silas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Amended JOC reflects 06-19-2015 Court order imposing 30 days condition time.

Defendant Shalonda M Silas not in court.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Shalonda M Silas in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Molly Schmidt for Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
JUDGE WAGNER FOR JUDGE DALLET.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months..
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 6/19/15.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victims, UNLESS the victims requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact and it has been approved by the MBCW.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
_Obtain GED/HSED.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shalonda M Silas in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SDS dob 12/28/09 and RSS dob 12/29/10 unless as approved per Children's Court Orders, or if Children's Court is not involved, unless as approved and monitored by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare.

Defendant Shalonda M Silas in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Shalonda M Silas in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Shalonda M Silas
Current: 832 W 25th Street, #3, Milwaukee, WI 53233   (Effective: 02-27-2015)
Prior: 430 West Keefe Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53212
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
